key: Ensures CloudTrail is enabled for all regions within an account.
Administrators MUST define and enforce a rotation policy for passwords and API keys.
Administrators MUST enable multi-factor authentication on any credentials used for interactive logon to the Cloud Account (e.g. AWS root account or IAM users).
Service owners MUST actively review any Cloud provider’s security assessments (such as AWS’ Trusted Advisor’s) and, upon discovery.
Administrators MUST notify the contract holders for the Cloud provider when a Cloud Account is no longer needed.
Remote Management interfaces for systems within a Cloud Account MUST only be accessible from IP’s that require access.
Administrators MUST enable netflow logging (or equivalent) for network traffic within their Cloud Account, where technically possible.
Service owners MUST actively review available security patches for Operating Systems, web- servers, application frameworks, etc. and apply relevant patches regularly.
Administrators MUST provide a point of contact for security and operational escalations regarding their Cloud Account.
Service owners SHOULD perform architectural reviews with provider-specific review services (where available).
